Special Instructions: On Route 16 a ~7.7 miles south of ERROL on the Androscoggin River - look for a pull off at a bridge on the left. A group of trippees with their bags should be sitting here ready to be picked up.
The Appalachia Trail head is located in a large parking lot--usually with a lot of cars. There is a large lake, Lake Durand, located on the opposite side of the road.
Driveway enterance has a small orange sign at its end that says "no camping," just before a big open field and Camp Walt Whitman. Do NOT drive down the small driveway
The drop-off is where a huge set of power lines cross the road. There are hiker signs. You'll pull-off on the right if you are coming from the South and left if you are coming from the North.
On gravel road, there will be a small pull off to the left and trail signs on either side of the road.
Drop off at intersection of 25A and baker road, a dirt road to the right if you're coming from Orford. Pull into the dirt road.

From WARREN, NH (and Rt. 25) take Rt. 118 North until you hit Rt. 112 at a T intersection. Take a left to go N on Rt. 112 for ~ 3 miles until you see a parking lot on your left. The Appalachian Trail crosses here as well.
Before a large white church on right and at the Bradford Golf Club sign turn right and descend down to the river through playing fields.

The turn from Washburn onto Mt. Cardigan road is a hairpin. If it's too tight, continue straight on Washburn and take your first right for a turnaround. The last 1.5 miles of Mt. Cardigan road are dirt, and has some steep sections. There is a turnaround at the lodge.
Stop at the intersection where Cardigan Mountain road turns left and Burnt Hill road goes straight. Use this intersection to turn around.

The drop off is in a parking lot with a trailhead for CASTLE RIDGE and/or ISRAEL RIDGE. Make sure not to drop off in the Appalachia Parking Lot (AMC lot), which is a very large lot further down Rt. 2 East.
After a half mile take a left onto Cloudland Rd. before the cemetery. 3.4 miles later the trailhead is on your right. It's easy to miss, so look for the Tree Farm sign. The trailhead is there.
If possible, pull off on the farm side of the road to prevent the need for trippees to cross the road.

Address: Dartmouth Skiway, 39 Grafton Turnpike, Lyme Center, NH 03769
Special Instructions: Please pull up directly in front of the Skiway Lodge. If you are the first bus arriving, please pull forward to allow space for up to two buses behind you. If you are not the first bus arriving, please let students out directly behind the bus in front of you. Please be sure you are not blocking the Grafton Turnpike.
Staging area 1/4 mile before the lodge
Look for a tree with "142" and "Dartmouth Sailing Facility" signs on it
A large parking lot at the base of Mt. Crawford on the East side of 302 about 8 miles west of Bartlett.

N MOUNTAIN POND RD is a dirt road with a sharp, steep entrance and a sign reading "TO PUBLIC WATERS." About one mile along this road, bear left. Continue on the road to the large parking lot and boat launch area at the end.

There is a small road (Ethan pond rd?) and parking lot on the west side of the road. On the same side, there is a sign saying something about "Ethan Pond trailhead" and "Ripley falls 20 mi hike each way." There is also an Appalachian Trail sign on the east side.
Stop at L.L Cote in Errol so anglers can get fishing licenses.
Look through the parking lot for a trip
If coming from the east (middle school side) park in the first pull off by the woodshed if possible.
The parking lot is on the left side of the road. You can use the entrance of the parking lot to turn around
If coach bus, don't pull into trailhead, but rather drop on the road.
Look for pull off and subtle trail sign to the left, parking immediately again to the left.
About 1.2 miles up Hight St. (just before reaching the Glencliff Home), look for a dirt parking lot with an Appalachian Trail signboard on the right.
Take East Wheelock out of Hanover until it becomes Trescott Rd. When it ends in Etna, turn left and follow this for 1 mile until it crosses the AT.
Drop at "no camping" sign in the valley betwen two knolls. Large pull off to the side of the road.
Take East Wheelock out of Hanover until it becomes Trescott Rd. When it ends in Etna, turn left and follow this for 1 mile until it crosses the AT.
Look for chained across driveway to the left, "no camping" sign
Grass/gravel pull-out on left, before reaching the Skiway
From WARREN, NH take 25 N for 4.5 miles until you see a large parking lot on the left. The Trip is dropped off here.

Address: Kilkenny Ridge Trailhead, S Pond Rd, Stark, NH 03582

Special Instructions: Take TRAILHEAD PARKING exit on 93 northbound. This parking lot can fill up on busy days. If you miss it, you'll need to go on the freeway for several miles to turn around. The roads in the parking lot on the southbound side are not large enough to accommodate buses.
Small pull off to the left if coming from piermont, right if coming from warren. About 0.5 miles from Cape Moonshine rd
Stop is in front of the Rowing Boathouse, a large white building at the end of the parking lot.

Go to intersection of Lime-Kiln Rd. and Rt. 25 in EAST HAVERHILL, NH. Turn onto Lime-Kiln Rd and go for 1.4 miles until you get to a junction where Lime-Kiln Rd. turns left. (Page Rd. continues straight). Drop trip here, turn-around can be done at this junction. (Non-coach vehicles can continue on Page Rd. until it dead-ends and drop them at the trailhead ~ 2.5 miles away).
The parking lot is just after you cross the Pemigewasset River. There is a sign for Lincoln Woods Visitor Center/Trailhead

Drop off in the parking lot of Lowe's Garage & Cabin Store (on the left side of Route 2). The trip should cross the road and turn right, walking about 50 yards to the trailhead (which will be on the left, opposite the store). If you reach the Appalachia parking area (AMC lot) and trailhead, you've gone too far by a mile or 2.
Luna Bleu is the second driveway on the right marked by a road sign "BOLES RD." Come up onto their "road" and they are the second house across from the barn.

Take Route 10 north from Hanover into Lyme. Coming around the green in Lyme, bear right at the white church and follow signs for the Dartmouth Skiway. Pass through Lyme Center 1.8 miles from the green in Lyme, and continue winding around for 1.3 more miles to where the wide gravel Lyme-Dorchester Road forks to the left. Take this fork for 1.8 miles until, just before the iron bridge over Grant Brook, a small parking lot is reached on the left. Orange signs mark the trailheads.

On Route 16 about 6 miles north of ERROL, NH at the Umbagog National Wildlife Refuge Office. Here, there is a good site for the bus to pull-off. A van should be visible at the drop-off (used to shuttle kayaks)

7.3 miles east of Route 3 on Route 110, you will arrive in Stark. After passing through Stark (identified by the covered bridge in town), look for the turnoff on your right, less than 1 mile outside of town. A brown hiker sign marks the Mill Brook Road. Drop students at Mill Brook Road.

Address: 234 Mirror Lake Rd, North Woodstock, NH 03262

Special Instructions: Bear right at the fork at the end of the road. Do NOT bear left and go down the hill. Turn around when the road ends, then let trippees off by the walkway on the right
If LARAMIE RD. turns to dirt you have gone too far. The farm is 1/2 mile on the left with big sign out on the road.
On Route 302, 0.5 miles north of Bartlett, turn northeast on Bear Notch Road. Stop at Mount Langdon Trailhead at end of road.
drop-off in the small gravel pull-out. next turn-around is 1 mile south, at Sawyer River road

Stop at the parking lot (road dead-ends here) for NORTH TWIN TRAIL. Continue to the parking lot where the bus can turn around. If lot is too full, there are many campsite driveways along the road that a bus can use to turn around in.

On Route 16 about .5 miles north of ERROL, NH at a break in the road across the street from the Errol School District. There isn't a great spot to pull off but you will see croolings on the side of the road.
Park in large gravel lot on the right, before going through the toll booth

Address: Appalachian National Scenic Trail, Glencliff, NH 03238
Special Instructions: Trailhead parking on the right if coming from Piermont, left if from Warren. Steep hill on the parking side.
Stop in small gravel pull-out by guardrail, on the other side of the road from wooden stairs. There are side roads 0.25 miles in either direction if you need to turn around

Address: 5964 Woodstock Rd, White River Junction, VT 05001
Special Instructions: Drop at visitor's center, just to the east of the bridge
1.5 miles east of Orfordville, Quinttown road is to the right. Pull into this intersection, drop the trip here. (after a "Trucks Entering" sign).

On Rt. 112 and drive past a group of white buildings on the left and a single one on the right. Drop the group off at the wooden bridge on your right. Just a bit farther on the left is Lost Valley road, where you can turn around if needed

Address: 6 North Main St, Hanover, NH 03755, USA

Special Instructions: The drop off spot is right over the border in Maine. LITTLEHALE RD is a dirt road in the middle of a big grassy field. Drive down this road a couple hundred feet to a pull off on the right where you can see the river. This whole area is Azicoos campground. Let the students off here. A Grant Croo member will be waiting or soon to arrive with a trailer of canoes. **There is a place to turn around at this campground.
On route 25A, after going down a steep hill, you'll see a big open field on your left. Stop at end of soccer fields (pull out on right).
On the right about 4 miles west of the Sabbaday Falls parking lot when heading west on the Kancamagus.

On DEAD DIAMOND RD continue until you get to the gate. There will be a person there (or there shortly) to let you in the gate. Continue to over the bridge, to a large turn around area on your right. Here is where you will drop off your trip and turn around. Head back south on the road and stop in front of GATE CAMP (the cabin on your right). Here is where you will pick up trips. A person will be there (or there shortly) to let you back out the gate.

About 15 miles (very approximate) outside of Groveton on Rt. 110, you will see a sign for the South Pond Recreation Center on your left. Turn left at this sign and follow winding road to the Recreation Center gate. Students will be waiting by the gate. Go as far as you can -- the road may be closed for the fall season. The group will meet you at the point where the bus must stop.
Drop off by the farm stand (on the right coming out of norwich). IF you see the Y for union village, you've gone too far.
Stop by a small orange and black sign on the right hand side of the road, accompanied with a small 3 car sized parking lot on the left. The trail intersects with the road here.

There is a small orange trail sign on the west side of the road. Just north of this is a small parking lot (on east side of road). There are side roads within a half mile to the north and south if you need to turn around

Take 25 North out of Warren, NH. You will pass through the (small) town of Glencliff, NH. A mile past Glencliff, there will be a pulloff on the left, with a sign marking the Appalachian Trail crossing the road.
Drop on the highway, not up the gravel road.
Buses will drop in CAMPGROUND, not at trailhead. Buses unable to go to trailhead lot because turnaround not guaranteed.
Address is for Northern Waters Outfitters. Park in the lot directly across the street from Northern Waters Outfitters.
